title: Person of Interest: Aletheia - Finch and Claypool
author: snatchingsouls
comment:
'We saved good people lost good people in the end I'm afraid we've only given the deck a shuffle'
what a line
Love this philosophical argument between Harold and Arthur very much. Thank you for uploading it!
One of the best dialogues in this season. "It's not my child, it's a machine!" said with a smile as if he already knows but is trying to deny it.
The moment that claypool's pointer goes yellow at 1:30... Wonderful
description: An interesting discussion on AI (Samaritan) between characters Arthur Claypool and Harold Finch.
